com.here.android.mpa.venues3d

Class Content

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.venues3d.Content

  • public final class Content
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates POI (Point Of Interest) information of the spatial area in a venue. Examples of POI information are the street address, access information, search tags, space type, category.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        public Address getAddress()
        This method retrieves the postal address of the spatial area.
        Returns:
        An object containing the address of the spatial area.

      • getSearchTags

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSearchTags()
        This method retrieves the tags which describes the content holder. For example, the tags for an electronics retailer may contain: television, phone, mobile, computer, and so on. The tags can help you search inside a venue (Venue) for specific key words.
        Returns:
        A list of text strings representing the tags.

      • getContentId

        public java.lang.String getContentId()
        This method retrieves the unique content identifier of the spatial area. Content ID can be used in PlaceRequest.PlaceRequest(String, String) together with reference name Request.VENUES_CONTENT_ID_REFERENCE_NAME to get reach information about the content. Request can fail if there is no information about the content in Places API.
        Returns:
        A String containing the content identifier.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This method retrieves the human-readable name related to the holder of the spatial area. This can be, for example, the name of a shop.
        Returns:
        The string containing the name.

      • getPhoneNumber

        public java.lang.String getPhoneNumber()
        This method returns the phone number related to holder of the spatial area.
        Returns:
        The string containing the phone number.

      • getWebsite

        public java.lang.String getWebsite()
        This method retrieves the URL of the web site related to holder of the spatial area.
        Returns:
        The string containing the URL.

      • getEmail

        public java.lang.String getEmail()
        This method retrieves the email address related to holder of the spatial area.
        Returns:
        The string containing the email address.

      • getParentCategoryId

        public java.lang.String getParentCategoryId()
        This method retrieves the parent Category identifier of the spatial area. This information can be used, for example, to check the type of the space: shopping, transportation-facility, etc.
        Returns:
        The string containing the parent category identifier.

      • getPlaceCategoryId

        public java.lang.String getPlaceCategoryId()
        This method retrieves the Category identifier of the spatial area. For example, this information can be used to check the type of store, such as food and clothing.
        Returns:
        The string containing the category identifier.
        See Also:
        Level.getSortedSpacesByCategory(String)

      • getUniqueVenueId

        public java.lang.String getUniqueVenueId()
        This method retrieves the unique venue identifier of the spatial area. This identifier is constant for each spatial area and can't be changed in later data updates.
        Returns:
        The string containing the unique venue identifier.

      • getCategoryId

        public java.lang.String getCategoryId()
        This method retrieves the venue-specific Category of the spatial area.
        Returns:
        The string containing the venue-specific category identifier.

      • getCustomAttributes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getCustomAttributes()
        Gets the Map<String, Object> of custom attributes. Attribute values may be of type java.lang.Boolean, java.lang.Double, java.lang.String, java.lang.List, and java.lang.Map.
        Returns:
        a java.util.Map<String, Object> from strings to values encoding the custom attributes or null if there are no custom properties.
